questions.question_text: Which of the following is the BEST control to detect potential internal breaches of personal data?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The keywords in the question are "potential" and "internal," so user behavior analytics would be a precursor to an actual breach that DLP would catch through exfiltration.

comments.content: Upon rereading the question, it's actually asking for detective control, so UBA is correct. I apologize.

Well, DLP monitor the actions related to data at rest, in use, and in transit to prevent unauthorized exposure. They can detect when sensitive data is being transferred, copied, or sent, which makes them especially relevant for detecting data breaches. I will pick "A" as the correct answer.

discussion.content: UBA only gathers info. on user behavior including opening application, accessing files, engaging in network activities. These are all after the facts, they're not preventive controls. A is the correct answer.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the BEST way to protect personal data in the custody of a third party?

discussion.content: C : include requirements to comply with the organization’s privacy policies in the contract. This ensures that the third party is legally obligated to adhere to the same privacy standards as your organization

choices.C: Include requirements to comply with the organization’s privacy policies in the contract.
choices.D: Add privacy-related controls to the vendor audit plan.
choices.B: Require the third party to provide periodic documentation of its privacy management program.
choices.A: Have corporate counsel monitor privacy compliance.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the GREATEST privacy concern for an organization implementing endpoint detection response (EDR) tools on employee laptops?

discussion.content: Answer D. EDR is like a antivirus, what mater is is it up-to-date.

Selected Answer: C
C. Poor controls on privileged access to EDR tools

Selected Answer: C
If there are poor controls to privilege access to the edr tools then the potential for unauthorised access to these tools exist and this can be a potential privacy issue.

Selected Answer: A
Lack of an acknowledged user acceptance policy seems correct. Lack of up-to-date EDR capability on employee laptops is a technical control issue, but not the GREATEST privacy concern.

B: Unclear monitoring scope 
Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) tools are designed to monitor, detect, and respond to security threats on endpoint devices. When these tools are implemented on employee laptops, they often have the capability to capture a vast amount of detailed data about user activities, system interactions, and more. The privacy concern arises when the monitoring scope of the EDR tool is unclear. Overreach and consent issues are some of the associated privacy risks.
It should be Lack of an acknowledge user acceptance policy?

choices.A: Lack of an acknowledged user acceptance policy
choices.C: Poor controls on privileged access to EDR tools
choices.D: Lack of up-to-date EDR capability on employee laptops
